0: Media caption The BBC's Alan Johnson: "We will never know the details of their talks" NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Newly elected Pope Francis has met his predecessor for lunch, the first time such a meeting has been possible for more than 600 years. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Pope Francis was flown by helicopter to Castel Gandolfo for the private lunch with Pope Emeritus Benedict. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Benedict has lived at the lakeside castle south of Rome since last month, when he became the first pope in six centuries to resign, citing ill health. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Cardinal Jorge Maria Bergoglio was elected to succeed him on 13 March. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR No known precedent NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR There was no official communique on the results of the Pope's brief lunchtime visit to Castel Gandolfo, says the BBC's David Willey in Rome. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Analysis There had been intense speculation about how Vatican protocol would deal with the first face to face meeting since the election of Pope Francis between the new Pope and the retired Pope. It was a carefully calculated mixture of formality and informality. Emeritus Pope Benedict embraced his luncheon guest on Pope Francis' arrival at the helipad at the papal summer villa at Castel Gandolfo, which has become Benedict's temporary home. Benedict, who stepped down from the papacy at the end of February, wore a white padded jacket and looked rather frail in comparison to 76-year-old Pope Francis, nine years his junior. The two white-clad clerics then prayed together in the villa's private chapel where Pope Francis insisted on kneeling side by side with his predecessor, rather than using the padded papal kneeler prepared for him. "No! we are brothers, we pray together!" Francis told Benedict in a gesture of humility. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR On the agenda, some delicate handover details, including a top secret document prepared by the former pope on last year's scandal involving leaked documents, our correspondent adds. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The new head of the Catholic Church is usually elected after the death of his predecessor, and there is no public record of any previous meeting between an incumbent pope and a former pope. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In 1294, former hermit Celestine V resigned after five months as pope. Boniface VIII was elected days later, and had his predecessor imprisoned. Celestine was dead within a year. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In contrast, Pope Francis has spoken warmly of his predecessor. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR One of his first acts as Pope was to call Benedict at Castel Gandolfo, where the former pontiff had been following proceedings on television. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The pope emeritus is expected to stay on at the papal summer residence until new accommodation being prepared for him inside the walls of Vatican City is ready at the end of April. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR For his part, Pope Francis will begin the Church's most important liturgical season on Sunday with a Palm Sunday Mass in St Peter's Square. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He will then lead six more liturgies during the week, culminating with the Easter Sunday Mass and Urbi et Orbi blessing. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR New style NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The new Pope chose the name Francis in honour of St Francis of Assisi - the 13th Century Italian saint who spurned a life of luxury to work with the poor. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He has called for the Roman Catholic Church to be closer to ordinary people, especially the poor and disadvantaged. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Castel Gandolfo retreat Picturesque lakeside "castle town" in the Alban hills, 15 miles (24km) south-east of Rome NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Dates back to the 17th Century; its gardens occupy the site of a residence of the Roman Emperor Domitian NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Benedict is staying at the palace while a permanent residence is readied inside the Vatican City walls NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He has a staff of two secretaries and four women helpers, and is guarded by Vatican police officers NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR And, only 10 days into his pontificate, he has made some subtle but significant changes in the lifestyle of the leader of the Roman Catholic Church, says our correspondent. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He dresses very simply, preferring to wear plain black shoes under a simple white habit rather than the red leather loafers and ermine-trimmed cape worn by his predecessor. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The first Latin American Pope spurned a special car to take a bus with his cardinals after he was elected, and insisted on returning to his Rome hotel the next day to pay his own bill. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR And Pope Francis places himself on the same level as his guests, rather than greeting them from a throne on an elevated platform, which is seen as a powerful gesture after centuries of Vatican pomp. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The former archbishop of Buenos Aires has also started inviting guests to his early morning Mass - including Vatican gardeners,
